description: Ms. codex. 21 long lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of magenta ink. All the texts in the volume are written by the same hand. European glazed paper with watermark. Some of the leaves are dyed red, yellow or pale green. Contains charts and tables. Marginal notes in text no. 1, written in the same hand. Collation statement on fol. 22a. Foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Copied in the first days of Jumādá al-Ulá 1201 by Muḥammad Najīb al-Azharī, known as al-ʻAṭṭār (colophon text 2, fol. 18b; text 3, fol. 23a; text 4, fol. 25b).
abstract: Volume comprising four texts on occult sciences (fortune-telling, talismans, divination).
contents: 1. fol. 1a-15b : Sharḥ Manẓūmat Kashf al-rān fī al-zāyirjah.
2. fol. 16a-18b : Sharḥ bayt min Manẓūmat Kashf al-rān / Muḥammad al-Ghamrī.
3. fol. 19b-23a : Bāb fī ḥall al-ṭilasm wa-īḍāḥ al-sirr al-mubham / [Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad al-Ghamrī al-Wāsiṭī].
4. fol. 23b-25b : al-Durrah al-muntakhabah fī al-suʼālāt al-muntasibah.
8. fol. 35a : [Charts with numbers and a heading "10"].
9. fol. 35b : Hādhā al-wafq al-sharīf al-mukhammas khālī al-wasaṭ qad nzlt fīhā qawluhu taʻālā ... [etc.], with a chart.
extent: i, 39, i leaves, ill. : paper ; 199 x 105 (138 x 60) mm. bound to 199 x 110 mm.
